answers.author: Michael Thompson
answers.text:
A bill was introduced at the state level to ban using hand-held cell phones while driving; this includes texting. I don't think the bill came out of committee. Typically, a bill takes a couple of sessions before being voted upon by the full body.

answers.author: Brian Wolverton
answers.text:
CT currently prohibits use of handheld phones, requiring use of a wireless bluetooth device or an earpiece.  (seems a bit silly, since you have to use your hands to take or place a call in the first place, and using a phone is just one of literally dozens of distractions that are equally likely to cause an accident, but that's beside the point).
Here's a link to the statute itself:
http://cga.ct.gov/2010/sup/chap248.htm#Sec14-296aa.htm
And here's a chart of what other states are doing about cell phone usage:
http://www.ghsa.org/html/stateinfo/laws/cellphone_laws.html

author: Evelina Moulder
text: Does your local government have a ban on texting while driving? If you have a ban, please share. If not, has there been any discussion about a ban? Thanks!
title: Texting While Driving
